trope_detail: Kirk ribs Spock about his heritage in the ending sequence.
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Kirk: Must be terrible having bad blood like that. (Kirk kidding Spock about his human half.)
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: McCoy (to Spock): Assuming you call that green stuff in your veins blood.
Why is Spock is insensitive? | Spock: That's the way I am.
McCoy: Smack right in the old heart. Oh, I'm sorry. In your case, it would be about here. | Spock: The fact that my internal arrangement differs from yours, Doctor, pleases me to no end.
Kirk: I'm tired of your half-breed interference Kirk (thinks this while in duplication machine to put a defect into the android double).
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk-android insults Spock with half-breed comment Kirk instilled in it.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: McCoy: The little bugs have no appetite for green blood.
McCoy: Did you get a look at that little Juliet, that's a pretty exciting creature . Of course your personal chemistry would prevent you from seeing that.
Kirk (directed at Lt. Stiles after hinted Spock was a Romulan spy): Leave any bigotry in your quarters, there's no room for it on the bridge.
Averted: Lt. Bowman (an African American) survives entire episode.
Lt. Bowman: I'm sick and tired of this machine.
McCoy: …those mathematically perfect brainwaves of yours.
McCoy: You bet your pointed ears I am. | Spock frowns, then Kirk laughs.
McCoy (to Spock): I'm sure you know the type (ambiuous scientists). Devoted to logic. Completely unemotional.
Kirk insults Spock by telling him his father was a computer and his mother an encyclopedia.
Kirk purposely insults Spock to try to break the spores hold.
Kirk has to deal a vicious speech to Spock in order to piss him off enough to get over the spores influence. An unusual case in that he didn't actually mean it.
Kirk (to Spock): I suspect you're becoming more and more human all the time.
McCoy (to Spock): Did the Horta have anything to say about those ears?.
Kirk: At times you seem quite human.
ep_title: The City on the Edge of Forever

trope: You Are A Credit To Your Race
trope_detail: Apollo: You seem wise, for a woman. (Apollo's take of the archaeology and ancient culture expert of the Enterprise crew.)
Spock: Dr. McCoys potion is acting like all his potions. Turning my stomach. | McCoy: If you're blood were red, instead of green, then you wouldnt have an upset stomach.
Spock: In my view, a splendid example of repriocity. | McCoy: It would take a computerized Vulcan mind such as yours to make that type of a statement.

Spock: We have given the people of Vaal the apple, the knowledge of good and evil if you will, as a result of which they too have been driven out of paradise. | Kirk: Are you casting me in the role of Satan? | Spock: Not at all Captain. | Kirk Is there anyone on this ship who even remotely looks like Satan? | Spock: I am not aware of anyone who fits tthat description Captain. | Kirk: No Mr. Spock, I didn't think you would.
Mudd: Spock, you're going to love it here. They all talk the way you do.
Mudd: You're so smart, Kirk. You and this pointy-eared thinking machine…

McCoy (to Spock: There's something wrong about a man who never smiles, whose conversation never varies from the routine of the job, and won't talk about his background. | Spock: I see. | McCoy: Spock, I mean, its odd for a non-Vulcan… the ears make all the difference. | Spock: I find your arguments strun with gaping defects in logic.
